intro: Gnaphalium petiolatum, commonly known as the slender cudweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist environments such as wet meadows and stream banks. It has slender, hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Its leaves are narrow and often have a woolly texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
